news.title: U.S. payrolls increased by 147,000 in June, more than expected
news.summary: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to increase 110,000 in June. The unemployment rate was forecast to rise to 4.3%. The economy is expected to grow by 0.3% in the second quarter.

news.title: Fourth of July barbeque prices have risen since Trump imposed tariffs, congressional analysis says
news.summary: Americans may spend more on barbeque items such as beer and outdoor chairs at their Fourth of July celebrations this year, according to a congressional report.

news.title: House vote on Big, Beautiful Bill moves ahead after Republican defectors flip
news.summary: The late-night vote to begin final debate marked a win for Republican leadership seeking to deliver on Trump's second term policy agenda. The final debate will take place on Wednesday night.

news.title: Airlines face investors after strong— but cheaper — July 4 holiday
news.summary: Major airlines pulled their 2025 forecasts earlier this year, blaming economic uncertainty. Airline executives blamed economic uncertainty for pulling out of the 2025 plan.

news.title: Apple's China iPhone sales grows for the first time in two years
news.summary: Apple is facing intense competition in China from a resurgent Huawei. Apple is facing fierce competition from Huawei in China. The two companies are expected to go head-to-head in the coming months.

news.title: What drove Del Monte Foods into filing for bankruptcy? Blame foodies.
news.summary: The iconic canned fruits-and-vegetables brand has struggled to keep up with the changing grocery landscape, experts say. The iconic canned fruit and vegetable brand has been in trouble for years. The company has been struggling to keep pace with changing grocery landscapes.

news.title: Can Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs recover financially now that he’s been found not guilty of the worst charges?
news.summary: The hip-hop mogul has already seen his net worth plummet from $900 million to $400 million, according to one estimate. His net worth has been estimated to be between $100 million and $200 million.

news.title: This fund returned 21% in May alone buying ‘left-for-dead’ stocks — and it has a new target
news.summary: Some of the bets made in the 2022 sell-off started to come good for Whetstone Capital this spring. An average holding period of three years meant some of the investments started to pay off.

news.title: ‘I’m single’: At 70, I have $500,000 in stocks and $220,000 in savings. How do I invest my $130,000 windfall?
news.summary: “I’m receiving enough Social Security to live on,” she says. “I'm receiving enough social Security to living on.”

news.title: What time does the stock market close today — and is it open on the Fourth of July? What about FedEx, UPS and mail delivery?
news.summary: Independence Day comes with many closures — although it may be a good time to hit the stores. There are many stores that will be closed for the holiday.
